results.title: And what about sugar ?
results.brief_description: This film glosses over the adverse effects of the consumption of sugar by implying that sugar is good for you in controlled doses, and that proper tooth care, rather than diet will prevent dental cavities. No other credits available.

results.title: Special trade
results.brief_description: A story about a friendship between a young girl and her grandfather. As a baby, the young girl was taken for outings and taught to walk by her grandfather. Then, one day he returns home from the hospital in a wheelchair and it is the young girl’s turn to take her grandfather for walks. Based on the book entitled “Special Trade” by Sally Whitman.

results.title: Sculpture of the Parthenon
results.creator_credit: Howard Tracy and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive coverage of the sculpture of the Parthenon. In addition to the remains in Athens, the film covers the full scale replica of the Parthenon at Nashville, Tennessee; the model and exhibits in the Royal Ontario Museum of Toronto, Canada. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Return
results.creator_credit: Sture Rydman, Elizabeth McKay and Jocelyn Films
results.brief_description: Edwardian England, a boarded-up mansion and rumours of ghosts provide some of the necessary ingredients for this compelling suspense film based on two short stories - “Nobody’s House” by A.M. Burrage and “The Middle Toe of the Right Foot” by Ambrose Bierce. A man who is seeking vindication of the man suspected of killing his bride shuts himself in the wedding room and confronts the ghosts of the bride.

results.title: My grandson Lew
results.brief_description: Adapted from the book of the same title by Charlotte Zolotow. The story of a six year old boy who disturbed by recurring memories of his grandfather whom he has not seen for some years, discovers from his mother that his grandfather died some time ago. Highlights the fact that emotions experienced alone can be shared with others who have had similar experiences. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Man of wheat: the saga of Glen Miller
results.brief_description: A study of Glen Miller, an ex-school teacher who went into farming in America in 1942, and who has since built up a huge acreage, coupled with a high level of capital invesment. His sons and grandsons help run the farm as well as maintain the huge and expensive machinery that lies idle all year round, except for the five weeks of harvesting when it is put to work seven days a week, eighteen hours a day. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Human journey: the early years
results.creator_credit: Jerry Lawton, CTV News and Films Incorporated

results.title: Islands within islands within islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Firstbrook, Rodger Jones, Andrew Crilly, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Studies the Hawaiian islands and the varied environments to be found there - eg deserts and frozen ash. Describes the formation of the islands and the ways in which plants may have migrated to newly formed volcanic islands. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
